Quick search

Module of basic, generic functions (mylib)¶

Specifically for Kriging/GEK.

class vkikriging.mylib.Timing(verbose=True)[source]¶

Bases: object

Very rough timing reporting with minimal code intrusiuon - call __init__() once at start, and monitor() to report each time increment. Turn stdout reporting off with verbose=False, times are still measured and stored in self.t1 (list).

monitor(message)[source]¶
reinit()[source]¶
vkikriging.mylib.covariance_to_stddev(Sigma)[source]¶

Obtain sample-wise standard deviation for given covariance matrix (extract the diagonal and take sqrt). Useful when plotting error bars.

Sigma - Square, +ve-def, covariance matrix, e.g. P or Sigmahat.

Return array (n).

vkikriging.mylib.enter_debugger_on_uncaught_exception()[source]¶

Automatically entering the debugger on any uncaught exception.

vkikriging.mylib.gek_composite(x, dx)[source]¶

For GEK create composite vector of values and gradients - return 1d vector xc. This function defines the order of entries in composite vectors, and we must be consistent. The reverse of this is gek_separate().

vkikriging.mylib.gek_separate(xc, d)[source]¶

Map composite vector returned by GEK into individual value and derivate vectors. This is useful for postprocessing output of gek() for plotting etc. Return x (n), dx (n x d).

vkikriging.mylib.get_aspect(ax)[source]¶

Compute the aspect-ratio of matplotlib Axis ax.

vkikriging.mylib.iowrite(filename)[source]¶

Print file-writing information to stdout (in blue!).
